page.title: 01NEWBURY BERKSHIRE
page.content: Newbury, an historic{market town}in South West Berkshire, is at the crossing point of two ancient roads, one linking Oxford and Southampton, the other Bath and London. The town's{population}of about 30,000 is growing due to the rapid expansion of local computer industries. Housing estates and shops are being built to serve this increase and also to provide homes for many commuters. Newbury is close to the M4 and has good rail and bus links. {Recreational facilities}include the expanding multi-sports Northcroft Leisure Centre.The once industrial Kennett & Avon Canal is now used for leisure pursuits. Newbury Race Course attracts many visitors. Recently, Newbury has received much publicity as {the site of the U.S. nuclear missile {base and Greenham Women's Peace Camp.
